content.description: Stand start with hands on both sides, and a left heel. The topout is trickier than it looks!
content.location: Just beyond trill and crawfish. On the way to the Salmon boulders. Po'lotī is on the far side of this boulder

content.description: Sit start as for Po'lotī, but exit up the line to the right.
Slab crimps lead to a mantle topout.
content.location: The river warrior boulder, just to the right of the small tree.

content.description:
Start with left hand palm pressing downwards and a high right hand crimp (stack pad if needed). Establish feet and then throw the left hand up for a good hold. Pull up into the crack, and then continue up the face on knobs.

A great climb with a bad, sloped landing! can be fixed with pads
content.protection: 3+ pads and spotter. Suggest folding one pad beneath others on the left side in order to make the landing more level.
content.location: The face of the main boulder. Climb straight up, directly to the left of the small tree.

content.description:
The left arete of the main boulder. Start hands crossed, with your right hand on the impeccable natural grip near chest height - or start lower for the full effect at the same grade.

Bust up with a big move, and continue onwards. Sustained climbing the whole way. Be sure to scope out the top - a few tick marks up top can be helpful to avoid a fall!
content.protection: at least 2 (large) pads and a spotter, or 3+ pads.
content.location: The left arete of the main boulder at the Mermaids.

content.description: Start on large crimps and then slap up the right arete.
content.location: The triangular boulder in the river next to Crawfish.

content.description: An "easier" topout with a worse landing. Climb Po'lotī, but continue climbing left to the last jug instead of topping out straight up and slightly right. One possibility to top out is to flip around near the top and sit on the rock as you climb.
content.location: Same start as Po'lotī - sit start all the way down on the right.

content.description: Start with both hands down on the right sloping shelf and low feet. Work up and left using heel hooks and toes, then back towards the right at the top. Flip the left hand around and press to mantle. Top out the center of the bulge.
content.location: A few more boulders downstream past Crawfish and Trilobite. On the way to the Salmon Boulders.

content.description:
Start with a left hand at chest height on the jugs, and a right hand high (stack a pad if needed to reach). Compress to establish a left heel and slap your left hand up the arete. Pulling hard to gain a high right foot on the start hold helps you gain the top of the bulge.

Make sure to pad the bottom of the landing well, and have 1-2 spotters.
content.protection: 2 or more pads and at least 1 spotter.
content.location: The bulge on the right side of the main boulder at the Mermaids

content.description: Start matched on the left hold with a heel out to the left. Move right to the next rail and match, then reset foot. Mantle up over ledge and look for crimps.
content.location: Smaller boulder directly to the left of the River Warrior Arete

content.description:
Start right hand sidepull, left hand high in the corner. Throw with either hand for the top jug.

A one move wonder, more difficult / dyno for shorter climbers.
content.location: On the other side of the small boulder, behind Dancing Reflections
